newsitem.title: USA: Compaq, Computer Assocs in data storage pact.
newsitem.headline: Compaq, Computer Assocs in data storage pact.

text.p: Compaq Computer Corp Wednesday said it and Computer Associates International Inc's Cheyenne division will jointly develop and market data storage systems.
Terms of the deal were not detailed.

Those systems, called enterprise storage management solutions, are capable of centrally storing all of a company's data and software applications. Traditionally tied to mainframe computers, these systems are increasingly linked to networks linking hundreds and even thousands of PCs.
The firm's will begin co-marketing activities in the first quarter of 1997. The first offerings resulting from this alliance are planned for later in 1997.
Through the alliance, customers wil be able to integrate and optimize data storage and storage management to access, protect, and manage their enterprise data.
Compaq will contribute its hardware integration expertise and Cheyenne's will input its management storage software expertise, they said.
